ratings.comment: I am a smart person and I had a really hard time with his style of teaching. I 100 percent respect him but he doesn't work for me. Be ready for really hard test questions..

He does not explain things well in class. I don't have the clue of what to review after class. Many problems in the test are not explained well in class. As a non-CSD major, I have to say that, DO NOT take this class just for the biological science credit, choose other classes instead.

This professor really made me work hard for my A. He teaches with depth and breadth. If you work hard in his class, you will have the strongest foundation in Hearing Sciences than anyone ever in CSD. You DON'T need the book. You MUST come to class to get an A. He does not explain concepts in multiple ways. It's the Lutfi way or the highway.

This class is not easy.  The textbook isn't necessary.  Do not miss class.  The first third of the class is the most difficult material.  His tests are word tricky so make sure you do the practice problems.  Ask questions during lecture and talk through the concepts with him that you struggle with.  He is very kind and wants you to succeed.

The first topic in CSD202 is by far the hardest of the 3 and it gets you really stressed about the class.  The 2nd and 3rd topics are much easier.  Bob is a SUPER nice guy but isn't always clear with his explanations.  If you go to him for help he is very willing to answer your questions.

Professor Lutfi is not very good at "dumbing down" information to our level. He's not good at making sure you understand what information is important or explaining examples well. I used wikipedia to explain a lot of the concepts to myself before the test. I ended up getting an AB, but this was a LOT harder than other the other CSD prereqs.

Although I have loved my other CSD classes, this class was not at all interesting. He seems like a nice enough guy, but he was extremely unorganized in his lectures. Missing lecture here or there may not be a big deal, but his slides uploaded on L@UW are not in depth. The tests aren't too bad if you study and there is an optional final.

His lectures are confusing- he is really nice and passionate about the subject, but he is terrible at specifying what is important and what you need to take away with each point. he rushes over examples that would be helpful and his slides are so unorganized, you leave lecture confused not knowing what the take away was supposed to be.

Seriously don't buy the book. It's a waste of money. Lutfi seems like a nice guy but his class is just plain boring. Only grades on four tests total, which are all pretty hard. You have to attend lecture and pay attention to pass these tests. I wouldn't take this class if you aren't intending to major in it. It's not easy.

This class can be a tough one if you don't have a proper approach. DO NOT buy the textbook. but in regards to notes, make sure you take notes on his lectures and what he says. if you depend simply on the power-points he uploads, you will fail the tests. There's 4 tests worth 25% each. just take good notes and study for a good grade!

Lutfi is obviously very knowledgeable about hearing, but can be hard to follow. If you are a comm dis major then you will likely enjoy this class, but do not take it just for the heck of it. Very little work outside of class is needed. Only 3 assignments (graded on completion) and 3 exams make-up the grade so it is essential to do well on each one.

Lutfi's lectures are super boring and unorganized. He definitely just re uses old slideshows and content from previous years. Visited him for office hours once and he was rude to my friend and I. Tests aren't too bad, mainly just definitions. Don't buy the book, totally unnecessary.

Lutfi's lectures are unorganized, boring, and he tends to ramble on. Went to his office hours and he was kind of rude, but in lecture he seems nice. Didn't do well on the tests personally, but the tests were mainly just definitions, so if you study for them, you should do fine. Don't buy the book, totally unnecessary.
Professor Lutfi is a nice guy and the class isn't too hard. He sometimes wanders off topic in lecture though and can be vague and forgetful.

The textbook is completely unnecessary and doesn't tie to lectures. Slides are of simple graphics that are explained poorly, and presentations have no organization whatsoever. Prof seems like a nice guy, but the complete and total lack of objectives, concepts, and structure makes this class nearly impossible.

Lutfi is a nice, calm guy, but his lectures are a bit unorganized. Some of the material was very abstract, and he needed to explain it more. Tests are fair as they are multiple choice, so you need to just memorize.

I took this class in fall 2010. He presented scientific course material as facts to be memorized and didn't explain why things worked the way they did. When I asked how things worked after class, he often didn't give an answer. Most of the guest lecturers weren't great either. The main upside of the class is that he's an incredibly fair grader.

Syllabus: 4 fifty-question multiple choice exams, 1 (optional) final. Going to lecture isn't required since all the notes are online. I didn't get much out of lectures because Lutfi seemed pretty unorganized.

I had Lutfi for 110 as well and didn't like his teaching then and I didn't like it again this time around. He is extremely confusing, he jumps around in his lectures, he is awful at communicating through email, and he made me feel dumb every time I went to office hours. It would be a million times better of a class if he was not the one teaching it

If I could have taken this class with another professor I would have. In every encounter I had with him he was rude and disinterested in what I had to say. His answers to e-mails were vague and never in full sentences. Weird because he seems nice while lecturing, it's just one-on-one he is like this. Grading ends up fair though.
Professor Lutfi is incredibly kind,super helpful and a master of psychophysical theory.  Plus he's one hot tamale.

Very enthusiastic, but uses tons of jargon without much clarification; I highly recommend meeting with the TA to clarify concepts! Lots of fascinating guest lecturers,who explain the material clearly. He posts all lecture slides online. Exams are based on lecture/slide information. Easy if you take time to "translate" his notes into simpler terms.
Very unorganized.
He's really nice and passionate about his field. The tests are mostly recalling learned info and gives 3 points extra credit. The lectures can be boring in the beginning, but it gets better.
3 midterms, 1 optional make-up. Material is easy to understand, but it's pretty boring stuff. First midterm is the most difficult--you must study A LOT for this one. Overall easy class.

Very easy class. DO NOT BUY TEXTBOOK. Tests are right from the slides. Guest lecturers are interesting. 3 midterms, 1 retake, if needed, and 3 points for extra credit that get added on to the overall score. GPA booster!

Professor Lutfi was overall a great professor, in terms of letting students know what material to know and what was expected. However, the course itself got a bit dry at times. Don't buy the textbook! You don't even need to look at it! Super easy class if you're looking for a social science requirement.
Ridiculously easy.  No need to go to class or even buy the book, I've gone through his power points the day before his midterms and have an A in the class.  He's pretty boring, but a nice guy.
Lutfi is a good speaker but kind of boring at times. As long as you pay attention and take minor notes, you should be able to pass any of his midterms with minimal difficulty.
Easiest class ever, but lectures are boring so just don't go, because all the powerpoints are online. Don't buy the book, I didn't even open it...final is optional

GO get the lectures' handouts, go to review sessions before exams just to get review handouts. Sure get an A. EVen if youre not, take the makeup final exam (optional) or do xtra credits, n you'll get an A

Not being a ComDis major, I really disliked this course. Only three midterms and optional final to replace bad midterm grade, but professor is suuuuuper boring!  Monotone voice and does not explain anything clearly. I only liked the guest speakers, who actually communicated with the audience and had presence.

Had him for 110 and 202. To be clear, 202 is MUCH harder that 110. Got an a in 110 without much effort and an AB in 202 putting in a lot of time. Went to class, read, studied, etc. I highly recommend him for 110, would avoid taking 202 if you're not going to be in Com Dis
Easy class. 3 exams and the final is optional and replaces the lowest exam grade. You get the grade you work for in this class.
he made lectures interesting and had plenty of guest lecturers and media use.

VERY VERY good class. professor Lutfi is very approachable and you can tell he really loves his job! definately a recommended class and he helped me to decide on a major in communicative disorders. Fairly easy class just pay attention and study before and everything is in the hand outs!

Easiest A ever. Three midterms and a final, and you get to drop your lowest score from the four. Just study the handouts because almost all questions come directly from them. Also possible to get extra credit.
I did not enjoy him or the class.
Such a nice man, but lectures are boring and useless- you do not need to attend lecture to do well. Tests are all multiple choice and overall an easy A. Great class and Com Dis is awesome.
Nice guy. Has a bland sense of humor that for some reason cracks me up! The class was pretty interesting, and VERY EASY!

Dr. Lutfi does a fine job with the class. He's definitely more of a researcher than a professor but he makes sure that it's clear what you need to know for the tests (gives review sheets, FAQs and example questions). His class is alright but it's never a big deal to miss a class.

This class is easily one of the easiest classes at UW. ALL of the lecture notes are online, he puts study guides online. I NEVER went to class (except for exams), filled out the study guides the day before and walked out with a solid A.

Easy class/teacher but extremely boring lectures. Unnecessary to attend any lectures because he puts all the slides online. Exams are a little hard but if you study you are fine. Awkward, monotone voice.

His material is hard to grasp, and he doesn't do the best job of giving the material a real world application. He is very nice, eager to help and answer questions, and holds a review session before every test. His homework is easy, but the material, again, is pretty dry.

He is a wonderful man. Cares a lot about the class and will help the students if they seek it. Overall not a difficult prof, but the more often you attend class and show him your face the more he will favor you. Trust me, it works to go to class.

Never need to go to class. Never used the book. Gives easy extra credit. Only times I went to class was the first day and the day of tests, I started studying the day before the tests and I ended up with a solid B in the class.  I bet if I started studying two days before tests I would have gotten an A.  EASY but necessarily not recommended.

Easy class, never use the book.Tests are based off the study guides, know everything on that and you ace the tests.Lectures are really boringif you cant sleep go to this class to catch up on your lost sleep.Three midterms and one final.You only keep your best three tests so if you do well on your first three you dont have to take the final. EC also

this class is very easy, just study the review sheet, powerpoint slides, and Faqs sheet that he hands out. It helps to at least come to the review session. He even does extra credit AND a makeup exam. you've go to be an idiot to fail this class or get anything less than a B.
Very interesting material and an easy class!  Funny guy, but lectures are all powerpoints and depending on the guest lecturer they can be pretty boring.

Super boring lecture.  Lets you drop one test grade, so if you're satisfied with your grade after three tests you don't have to take the final.  Adds percentage points onto your grade if you do extra credit.  Overall, it was easy but sleep-inducing.
this class sucks and is hard now. DO NOT take this class. used to be easy cause he gave study guides- now he doesn't, and the average on the first test was a C.
So easy!! Every question on exams is from the study guide, so coming to class isnt really necessary. A monkey could take this class and get an A.
boring as heck... don't even bother coming to this class-- all notes are online, and all the answers are from them. very nice guy!!
INCREDIBLY boring.  I never used to sleep during class but this class changed my mind.  I sleep nearly every class but the class is SUPER easy.
No Comments
EASIEST CLASS EVER. The ONLY class I have taken here and gotten an A. I'm about to be a senior.

VERY EASY CLASS!  Studying isn't really necessary...had optional final that would only help your grade and extra credit opportunities. Not the most interesting class, but not awful either.  If you want an easy A, take this class. You dont need/use the textbook, so don't buy it.  i never opened it

Nice guy. Tests are somewhat difficult, and do require some studying.  Lots of extra credit and optional makeup exam to help boost grade.  Brings in guest speakers.  Some are good, others very boring.  I found hearing unit to be the most difficult.
Very nice guy, cares for his students, wants you to learn. Tests are fair. Reminds me of a high school class-gives lots of extra credit. Most lectures are fairly interesting.
